text.0:
A viral post on WhatsApp claims successful N-Power candidates have been shortlisted. However, the supervising ministry in charge of the N-Power programme has confirmed that the claim is false. 
Read the fact-check here: https://t.co/ioXpqpLA3z #DubawaChecks
text.1: Experts have revealed the role 'Fake News' played during the #EndSARS protests and why week after the protests, ‘Fake News’ still dominates reports around the protest in Nigeria. Read here: https://t.co/WJk7Dv5PYq #DubawaChecks
text.2: The significance of fact-checking in today’s information overflowing world is enormous. In this piece, we highlight the importance of fact-chekers and why they do what they do. Read here: https://t.co/4KLHeWTvx8 #DubawaChecks
text.3: The government is not giving out grants to young Nigerians as part of the Nigerian Youth Investment Fund (NYIF). A viral message that claims they are is false. Read the fact-check: https://t.co/ccnhTRr84C #DubawaChecks
